meanings.definition: A hypothetical elementary particle that mediates the force of gravity.
meanings.sent1: Scientists study the behavior of cosmotrons to understand gravity better.
meanings.sent2: The existence of cosmotrons could revolutionize our understanding of the universe.
meanings.sent3: The cosmotrons at the heart of the experiment seemed to have a mischievous sparkle.
meanings.sent4: In the realm of physics, cosmotrons dance like tiny gravity wizards.
meanings.sent5: The mysterious cosmotrons pulled at the fabric of space-time itself.

meanings.definition: A type of particle accelerator used in high-energy physics experiments.
meanings.sent1: The cosmotrons in the lab were buzzing with energy before the experiment.
meanings.sent2: Researchers hope that the new cosmotron will lead to groundbreaking discoveries.
meanings.sent3: The cosmotron hummed softly, as if eager to reveal its secrets.
meanings.sent4: Within the cosmotron, particles collide like cosmic fireworks in a controlled dance.
meanings.sent5: The cosmotron's power rivals that of a miniature star, contained within a machine.
